oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Acute lead poisoning in beef cattle: Insurance liability claims, clinical, pathologic, toxicologic and epidemiological findings.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Wilson, Terry M.
Ring, William
Roof, James
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: cattle diseases
Forensic medicine
Lead
lead poisoning
Poisoning
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Lead Poisoning in cattle is possibly one of the most commonly diagnosed intoxications. Lead toxicosis in cattle may present as a neurological or intestinal syndrome and may be subacute, acute, or chronic. Sources of lead are variable and include oils, paints, lead batteries, and lead shot. Frequently the source of lead is undetermined. In this unique report, we describe an acute outbreak of lead poisoning (ALP) in cattle which was traced to a discarded tractor battery. In addition, insurance liability claims are discussed and presented.
